Articles.Content:
Decided to re-release my first (joke) part, now that it can actually be used for something:

Download here License: CC BY-SA 3.0
Thank you. Now i can start my research rover program

Awesome! Have you considered becoming part of the Community Science Project? Cabana Corp's own "Expanded Probe Capabilities" would benefit a lot from this experiment!

Also, maybe add some different flavour text to represent that it's on a probe and there are no Kerbals around to.. um... lick the samples...

Edited October 24, 2013 by BananaDealer
Where's that big eye from ? I've seen it before in relation to mechjeb I think, but I've never seen it anywhere since.
can we have better texture and colors?

Another mod that should be stock.

P1t1o - The big eye is from a robot in the game "Portal".
I wrote about this happening a few days ago - but I honestly thought it would be a scaled down version of a Kethane drill ... how I erred!

Decided to re-release my first (joke) part, now that it can actually be used for something...

Haha, awesome! Very prescient of you!

How did you find the surface sample Module btw.?

No part could do this before, so I did not bother to look into part.cfg files.

How did you find the surface sample Module btw.?

No part could do this before, so I did not bother to look into part.cfg files.

Its a experiment ID you can assign for the ScienceExperiment module. I was planning to do this but i got beat to it. Oh Well.
Yes, but being a coding noob I would not know where to find it - I never stumbled across the part.cfg for a Kerbal.

Yes, but being a coding noob I would not know where to find it - I never stumbled across the part.cfg for a Kerbal.

It doesn't matter. Experiment IDs are in the ScienceDef.cfg. Which means you can add any experiment to any part using the Experiment Module...

Where's that big eye from ? I've seen it before in relation to mechjeb I think, but I've never seen it anywhere since.

It's "SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE" personality core from Portal 2:

It doesn't matter. Experiment IDs are in the ScienceDef.cfg. Which means you can add any experiment to any part using the Experiment Module...

See, that was my question.

Thank you!

Excellent work, r4m0n! I've been trying to turn a KAS part on a winch into a soil collector (specifically, the radial port), but for some reason, as soon as I lower the winch, it loses all ability to collect soil samples (either through action groups or right clicking).

I may have to use this instead. I've tried modifying the CFG of the KAS part, but can't figure out what I'm doing wrong.
